alert.note: Alert for Mora; Taos (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 1:03PM MDT until July 25 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in north central New Mexico, Taos. In northeast New Mexico, Mora. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1259 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms over the far northwest portion of the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon burn scar. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding in Alamitos Creek, Rito Angostura, Piedra Creek, and the Rio Pueblo downstream through at least Tres Ritos. Up to 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. The potential exists for flash flooding to develop. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tres Ritos, Vadito, Picuris Pueblo and Rio Lucio. - This includes the following highways... State Road 518 between Mile Markers 40 and 57. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Both localized and distant heavy rainfall will create sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos and over low water crossings.
